t: Psalm 34
Taste and See That the Lord Is Good
Of David, when he changed his behavior before Abimelech, so that he drove him out, and he went away.
I*pn will bless the Lord*s at all times; his*ld praise shall continually be in my mouth.
My*ln soul makes its boast in the Lord;*s let*ld the humble hear and be glad.
Oh,*ln magnify the Lord*s with me, and*ld let us exalt his name together!
I*pn sought the Lord,*s and he answered me and*ld delivered me from all my fears.
Those*ln who look to him are radiant, and*ld their faces shall never be ashamed.
This*ln poor man cried, and the Lord*s heard him and*ld saved him out of all his troubles.
The*ln angel of the Lord*s encamps around*ld those who fear him, and delivers them.
Oh,*pn taste and see that the Lord*s is good! Blessed*ld is the man who takes refuge in him!
Oh,*ln fear the Lord,*s you his saints, for*ld those who fear him have no lack!
The*ln young lions suffer want and hunger; but*ld those who seek the Lord*s lack no good thing.
Come,*pn O children, listen to me; I*ld will teach you the fear of the Lord.*s
What*ln man is there who desires life and*ld loves many days, that he may see good?
Keep*ln your tongue from evil and*ld your lips from speaking deceit.
Turn*ln away from evil and do good; seek*ld peace and pursue it.
The*pn eyes of the Lord*s are toward the righteous and*ld his ears toward their cry.

When*ln the righteous cry for help, the Lord*s hears and*ld delivers them out of all their troubles.

Many*pn are the afflictions of the righteous, but*ld the Lord*s delivers him out of them all.
He*ln keeps all his bones; not*ld one of them is broken.
